result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley J Schmitt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program only after completing 9 mos confinement.

superMiscConds.notes: If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol.

Defendant shall not possess/consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall not associate with any known drug users or be in any place where drugs are used or sold.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with P.J. Krueger or Anthony Kudek.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall provide DNA sample.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment, schooling or combination of both.

Def in person & by Atty William Andrew Mayer.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Discussion re Information not being timely filed.  Def waives time limits; Court questions def and accepts waiver.  State files and Court reviews Information.  Agreement reached w/PSI being recommended on Ct 3 - State agrees to not exceed recommendation.  State moves to dismiss and read-in Ct 1, Ct 2, Ct 4; Court so orders.  Def enters guilty plea to Ct 3.  Court finds def guilty on Ct 3 and orders presentence investigation be prepared.  Jury trial set 5-18-15 & 5-19-15 removed from calendar.  Bond kept in place; Court admonishes def re conditions.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
